cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles south-southeast of Savannah, Georgia
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northward just off the southeast U.S. coast, turning north-northeast toward South Carolina and southern North Carolina before curving eastward into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Charleston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Fernandina Beach FL; Hurricane Warning north of Fernandina Beach FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through the Georgia, South Carolina and southern North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds highly likely (99% chance of ≥34 kt; 56% chance of ≥50 kt) with gusts possibly reaching hurricane force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 6–9 ft possible along the northeast Florida coast and into portions of the St. Johns River near Jacksonville.
weather_observation.rainfall: Event-total rainfall could exceed 4 – 8 inches with localized higher amounts; additional 1 inch possible after 07 Oct 2300 EDT.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; potential river flooding along the St. Johns River and low-lying coastal areas.
